intro: Microula efoveolata, commonly known as the smooth-leaved microula, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh environments, storing water in its fleshy stems and leaves. Its growth habit is typically low and spreading, allowing it to thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Microula efoveolata is often used in traditional medicine and is of interest for its potential ecological and pharmacological properties.
